equipment.name: Bruker Kappa Appex II X-ray diffractometer
equipment.details: using the Mo Ka radiation (k = 0.71073 A)

equipment.name: 6440B Wayne Kerr precision component analyzer
equipment.details: used for measuring temperature and frequency dependence of real and imaginary parts of dielectric constant and ac conductivity

equipment.name: computer-controlled modified Sawyerâ€“Tower circuit
equipment.details: used for measuring electric hysteresis loops

preparation_details.details: Single crystals were finely grinded and transformed into pellets under 10 MPa stress. Pellets were electroded using a high grade silver paste on both the facets and dried at room temperature.
Measurements were carried out in liquid nitrogen at temperature steps of 5 K, with the frequency fixed at 50 Hz and the samples submerged in insulating oil.

theoretical_details.details: Used to optimize the geometry of the unit cell of the metal organic framework, [Nd(C4H5O6)(C4H4O6)][3H2O]. The experimentally obtained crystallographic data were used as an initial guess.
